page.title: 09The First Woman Constable
page.content: The island of Jersey is divided into 12 parishes each with a constable (connetable) who is the civic head of the parish, the leader of the Parish Assembly and in charge of the Honorary Police. In an interview with the children of the parish school, Mrs. Le Feuvre, the first woman connetable in Jersey, said that she was proud to hold the position and determined to prove that a woman can perform the task well. Her priorities are to maintain the parish properties, which she sees as a trust handed down from former generations, and she hopes to establish some sheltered accommodation for elderly parishoners who wish to stay in St.Lawrence when their own homes are no longer suitable for them. Mrs. Le Feuvre's aim is that people of all ages in the parish should feel important and cared for.
